page.title: 01Morpeths Rural West Fringe
page.content: The N.E. end provides an older housing development over looking a large, well patronised golf course. The peoples common land lies alongside the golfing green which provides a pleasant green rural aspect as one approaches the town. The Morpeth A1 by pass cuts its way alongside the common with cultivated farm land on its west side. Searle Chemical Company factory, which is the largest employer in the Morpeth area is situated on the B6524 Road. There is a morning and evening bus provided for these workers. The rural community of Tranwell is situated nearby surrounded by well cultivated farmland. To the South are a number of luxurious homes,housing business executives commuting in to Newcastle, set amongst a pleasant cluster of woodland.
